Brooklyn Historical Society
Plum Island chronicle and photographs ARC.312
0.2 Linear Feet in two folders
circa 1900s The collection consists of a handwritten journal documenting a group trip to Plum Island and related photographs, dating from circa 1900s. A brief history of the island is included in the journal. Plum Island is located east of the North Fork of Long Island. A0036
Scope and Contents
The collection consists of a handwritten journal documenting a group trip to Plum Island and related photographs, dating from circa 1900s. A brief history of the island is included in the journal. Plum Island is located east of the North Fork of Long Island. Individuals represented in the photographs include the following: Howland Gardner, Charles Gardner, Steve Gardner, Will Reeves, Nathan Smith, and S. Lester Fuller. They are refered to as the Smoke Pipe Club.
Conditions Governing Access
Open to users without restriction.
Conditions Governing Use
The rights status of the collection has not been evaluated. Please consult library staff for more information.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Immediate source of acquisition unknown.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date (if known); Plum Island chronicle and photographs, ARC.312, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
Processing Information
The collections combines two accessions: 1974.138 and V1997.008. Photographs from the journal were originally part of accession 1974.138. They were removed, replaced with photocopies, and assigned the V1997.008 identifier in 1997.
